abstract: The Trans Alaska Pipeline System has temporarily restarted the flow of oil, though repairs were not complete on a leak that forced a shutdown on Saturday.
snippet: The Trans Alaska Pipeline System has temporarily restarted the flow of oil, though repairs were not complete on a leak that forced a shutdown on Saturday.
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON  Worried about the effect of freezing temperatures, the operator of the Trans Alaska Pipeline System said Wednesday that it had temporarily restarted the flow of oil through its 800-mile network, even though repairs had not yet been completed on the leak that forced the shutdown of the system on Saturday.

headline.main: Oil Pipeline in Alaska Has Plan to Restart
